alert.note: Alert for Comanche (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 9:00PM CDT until May 19 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Comanche County in Central Texas. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Comanche, De Leon, Gorman, Proctor Lake, Comyn, Beattie, Van Dyke, Downing, Duster, Sidney, Hasse, Rucker, Sipe Springs and Proctor.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
